fields.name: Coffee Cherry Tea
fields.description: Coffee cherry tea is a herbal tea made from the dried skins of the coffee fruit. Coffee cherries contain caffeine, as does the tea, though while the tea is popularly understood to have a high level of caffeine, it actually only has about a quarter the caffeine levels of coffee.Proper brewing yields a dark red tea; brew time guidelines range from 4 minutes to 7 or 8 minutes.

fields.name: Black Tea
fields.description: Black tea is a type of tea that is more oxidized than oolong, yellow, white and green teas. Black tea is generally stronger in flavour than other teas. While green tea usually loses its flavour within a year, black tea retains its flavour for several years.

fields.name: Moroccan Mint Tea
fields.description: Moroccan mint tea is a green tea prepared with spearmint leaves and sugar, traditional to the Greater Maghreb region (the northwest African countries of Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia, Libya, and Mauritania). The tea is first put in the teapot and a small quantity of boiling water is added. The tea is left to infuse for approximately 20â€“30 seconds. This initial liquid is poured out and kept aside.
